name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Clefairy's type is still Colorless.)

effect.note: Clefairy remains Colorless regardless of copied attack

flavorText: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

strengths: Metronome can copy any attack regardless of cost
No energy discard when copying attacks that require it
Works with any energy type (Colorless costs)
Sing provides cheap status condition option
weaknesses: Fighting weakness means Hitmonchan one-shots it
Metronome's effectiveness depends on opponent's Pokemon
Copying weak attacks wastes Clefairy's potential
3 energy for Metronome is slow for such low HP
counters: Pokemon with weak attacks (nothing good to copy)

competitiveHistory: Clefairy saw some play as a tech card due to Metronome's ability to punish opponents playing high-cost attackers. It was particularly effective in casual play where Charizard was popular, but its fragility limited competitive viability.

rulings.ruling: Metronome copies the attack exactly as printed, but ignores Energy costs and discard requirements.
Clefairy remains Colorless type when using Metronome, even if copying a typed attack.
If the copied attack does damage based on Energy attached to the user, use Clefairy's attached Energy.
